info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 11:21PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN MERCER...SOUTHERN VENANGO...BUTLER...NORTHEASTERN ALLEGHENY...NORTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND...ARMSTRONG...CLARION AND SOUTHWESTERN FOREST COUNTIES THROUGH MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1121 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northeast of Slippery Rock to near Edgewood. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Ross Township, McCandless Township, Butler, Clarion, Vandergrift, Kittanning, Apollo, Knox, Rimersburg, and Shaler Township. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 34 and 52. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 29 and 63. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 69 and 73. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
